RelatedSentence: The scale on which fish are currently farmed makes it necessary to protect them , by means of vaccination , against disease and premature death .
That is the view Professor Geert Wiegertjes expressed on 15 May upon formally accepting the post of personal Professor of Cell Biology and Immunology at Wageningen University .

RelatedSentence: The immune system is to some extent genetically determined but it also has an acquired or learned component .
However , new research has shown that this component also has a form of memory .

That opens up new perspectives for vaccination and other measures for enhancing the immune system in fish .

A1: a great deal of research into
RelatedSentence: Professor Wiegertjes and his international colleagues do a great deal of research into the immune systems of cultivated fish .
Besides the applied research on what is called ' production fish ' , Mr Wiegertjes and his colleagues perform more fundamental research in aquatic biology .
They use zebrafish - a vital biological model in this discipline - to do that but also to research human health .

A0: Geert F. Wiegertjes -LRB- born in Hoogezand-Sappemeer in 1963 -RRB-
RelatedSentence: He studied in Wageningen and obtained his doctorate here in 1995 on the immunogenetics of disease resistance in fish .
